newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: SOCCER-SCOTLAND TO PLAY ESTONIA IN MONACO.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-SCOTLAND TO PLAY ESTONIA IN MONACO.

text.p: The World Cup qualifying match between Scotland and Estonia will be replayed in Monaco on February 11, FIFA, world soccer's governing body, said on Wednesday.
Scotland had originally been awarded a 3-0 victory when Estonia failed to appear at the appointed kick-off time. The group four game had been moved forward three hours due to poor lighting.
FIFA, however, later upheld an Estonian appeal and ordered the match to be replayed.
With Scotland and Estonia unable to reach agreement on a venue, FIFA has ordered the match to be staged in Monaco at the Louis II stadium.
FIFA has also said it will cover the costs of the official Scottish team delegation.
